result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony M. Dicello was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony M. Dicello is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony M. Dicello was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay fine of $1000  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  Perform   100   hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony M. Dicello

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Agent Gilby DE has paid his financial obligations so the probation review is canceled for 9/16/16.
Probation review hearing on September 16, 2016 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Anthony M. Dicello, appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Count 2 - Dismissed by the State.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 6 months with conditions.  As a condition DE is ordered to complete 100 hours of community service.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.     Court imposes a fine of $1000 plus costs & surcharge to be paid during supervision.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Pre-Trial authorization - filed by Atty A Dicello  Authorizes his attorney to appear.

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No drug paraphernalia
961.41(3g)(e) - Poss of THC  /  961.573(1) - Poss of drug paraphernalia

125pm
  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Terry Rose.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Defendant requests Jury Trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 01:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.  $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).   jk
